page.title: 08DALRY(KIRK) SCHOOL
page.content: Dalry(Secondary) School serves a large geographical area extending from Carsphairn to New Galloway and from Corsock to Clatteringshaws. 70% of the children are broughtin by bus or special cars every day.The school day starts at 08 55 and ends at 15 30 for both primary and secondary pupils. Midday meals are prepared on the school premises. There are 90 pupils in the secondary school studying a wide range of subjects.There are 12 specialist teachers,including French and German. There are 73 children in the primary department taught by four teachers There are other primary schools in Kells(New Galloway), Carsphairn and Corsock. Pupils wishing to study beyond the age of 16,have to travel to either Castle Douglas or to Kirkcudbright.
